result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan T Meleski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathan T Meleski in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Nathan T Meleski. Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
For reasons set forth in the record, State needs additional time and requests an adjournment. Court grants request.
Case is adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement, Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Nathan T Meleski in court.  Attorney Kevin Gaertner for Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Nathan T Meleski.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defense requests projected deferred prosecution agreement hearing date.  
Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nathan T Meleski in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer from the state and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Nathan T Meleski in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/12/22 @ 2:30p
